meanings.def: a piece of thick woven material made of wool, etc., used to cover the floor of a room or stairs; the material used for carpets
examples: He spent the morning laying the new carpet.
(British English) We have fitted carpets (= carpets from wall to wall) in our house.
I'm having the carpets fitted today.
The cat curled up on the carpet.
The grey vinyl floor gave way to carpet tiles.

meanings.def: a thick layer of something on the ground
called to see somebody in authority because you have done something wrong
examples: I got called on the carpet for being late.

meanings.def: to try to stop people from finding out about something wrong, illegal, embarrassing, etc. that has happened or that you have done
examples: An earlier report, implicating the government, had been conveniently swept under the carpet.

meanings.def: to cover the floor of a room with a carpet
examples: be carpeted (in/with something) The hall was carpeted in blue.

meanings.def: to cover something with a thick layer of something
examples: be carpeted (with/in something) The forest floor was carpeted with wild flowers.

meanings.def: to speak angrily to somebody because they have done something wrong
examples: be carpeted Senior officials were carpeted for leaking information to the press.
